summary: This bill, the "Improving Capital Allocation for Newcomers Act of 2025," introduced in the House of Representatives, aims to amend the Investment Company Act of 1940. It focuses on the definition of qualifying venture capital funds. Specifically, it proposes to increase the limit on the number of investors a fund can have before being subject to regulation from 250 to 2,000.  It also suggests raising the threshold for assets under management from $10 million to $150 million.
